Appellation: Santa Cruz Mountains, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Smoked red fruit and red spice aromas make for a very dry nose on this blend of 74% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc and 1% Merlot. There's a leathery texture to the palate, where dried meat and cherry compote flavors compete for attention, as cinnamon spices up the long finish. Drink now-2039.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Lexington 2019 Apex Gist Ranch Estate Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)Cellar Selection

Appellation: Columbia Valley (WA), Columbia Valley, Washington, US
Description: This Cabernet Sauvignon with 5% Merlot is graceful and balanced like a Flying Wallenda. Red cherry and flaky pie crust aromas, along with a hint of pipe tobacco, fill the air. Black cherry and graphite flavors are fantastic, but the wine's sleek mouthfeel and silky tannins steal the showâ€”a must-try.                      Michael Alberty
Name: Gramercy 2019 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon-Merlot (Columbia Valley (WA))Editors' Choice

Appellation: Adelaida District, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Baked blackberry, leather, cocoa and espresso-bean aromas show on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Malbec and 17% Petit Verdot. The palate is generous in fruit, tense in tannins and very approachable, showing creamy blueberry, pepper and wild-herb flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Halter Ranch 2019 Ancestor Red (Adelaida District)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: This wine's label refresh comes with a more focused blend of 78% Cabernet Sauvignon, 16% Petit Verdot and 6% Malbec inside but a similarly fair price.. Baked plum, nutmeg and more barrel-spice aromas are well integrated on the nose. Chiseled tannins frame a palate of fresh red-fruit-jam flavors, along with cardamom and mace spices.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Peachy Canyon 2020 Cirque Du Vin Red (Paso Robles)Editors' Choice

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dense in the glass and dry on the nose, this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc offers leather, dried meat, charcoal and blackberry aromas. A cigar box flavor runs through the palate, which also offers baked red fruit, anise and gingerbread flavors.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Defiance 2018 Whipper-in Estate Red (Paso Robles)

Appellation: Paso Robles, Central Coast, California, US
Description: Dried cherry and fresh red-flower aromas show on the nose of this blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Merlot, 12% Cabernet Franc and 10% Petit Verdot. Bright strawberry flavors are spiced by cinnamon and sumac on the lively (rather than brooding) palate.                      Matt Kettmann
Name: Le Vigne 2019 Nikiara Red (Paso Robles)
